strategies.strategyTitle: DEA National Virtual Pointer System (NVPS) Modernization
strategies.useOfSavingsAvoidance: The National Virtual Pointer System (NVPS) is an automated system that connects target deconfliction systems which allows participating federal, state, or local law enforcement agencies access to agency target information through a single point of entry.  This initiative has two cost saving components: 1) eliminate the RISS support costs associated with managing the NVPS hub, and 2) modernize the integration between NVPS and NDPIX to eliminate the DOJ mainframe file transfer charges.

The Cyber De-confliction initiative extends data sharing to participating partner de-confliction systems, by adding support for cyber data elements. The costs savings are provided by internally developed solutions, which are estimated to save approximately $300K per year.
The Drug Overdose Tracking Initiative will provide significant cost avoidance by leveraging internal resources to provide a web site where information can be collected and tracked.
Cryptologic support of law enforcement activity

strategies.strategyTitle: JMD OCIO Automated Litigation Support Services
strategies.useOfSavingsAvoidance: Costs avoided through the ALS Services program will be used to fund the identification and evaluation of new technologies so DOJ can maintain its currency with the ever-evolving technology for social media, corporate communications, and other litigation data sources. It may also be used to increase DOJ's litigation capacity in terms of the number of cases litigated, the amount of data that can be processed, and the number of attorneys/case teams engaged.
Purchase of additional supplies.
